Cait Harrigan, MSc.


cait.harriganmail.utoronto.ca  |  View this CV online at caitharrigan.ca/cv


I am a graduate student at the University of Toronto supervised by Quaid Morris and Kieran Campbell, and a graduate affiliate at the Vector Institute. I did my undergraduate studies at the University of Toronto, in Computational Biology and Statistics. My thesis work pertains to cancer genomics, and modelling the evolutionary constraints that underlie how mutation events occur in DNA. I’m passionate about open science, and promoting great mentorship in the sciences.

ACM SIGHPC Computational & Data Science Fellowship, Special Interest Group on High Performance Computing of the Association for Computing MachineryThe ACM SIGHPC Computational and Data Science Fellowship fellowship is a highly competitive recognition, awarded for overall potential for excellence in data science and computational science, and the extent to which awardees will serve as leaders and role models to increase diversity in the workplace. My fellowship was renewed for a second year.

Mentoring


when


what


Aug 2020 — Aug 2021


Mentor, Her Code CampHer Code Camp is a free computer science camp for senior high school students in the greater toronto area who identify as a woman, non-binary, or transgender. Over 3 weeks, mentors guide the development of a project in python, and cultivate curiosity in computer science.


Sep 2020 — Nov 2020


Mentor, ProjectX machine learning research competitionWorked with a group of 4 students to refine their research proposal, offer advice and guidance on their project design and execution.


Oct 2018 — May 2019


Mentor, Mentorship Program, Department of Statistics, University of TorontoCommunicated online and in person with a group of 12 mentees, who were first year undergraduate students in the Statistics Department. Focus on community building and guiding transition into university life, in particular for international students.


Sep 2016 — May 2019


Mentor, SPROUT Peer Mentorship Program, New College, University of TorontoMet bi-weekly one-on-one with 2-3 first year undergrad students. Focus on guiding the transition to university life.


Event organization & volunteering


when


what


Oct 2020 — May 2021


Project Manager, STEMHub FoundationSTEMHub is a charity that aims to increase accessibility to STEM programs for underserved or low-income communities within Ontario. Led program planning. Designed hands-on science workshops for ages 10-14. Purchased and distributed materials.


May 2018 — May 2019


Founder and treasurer, Bioinformatics and Computational Biology Student Union, University of TorontoManaged the union’s annual budget, and event budgeting. I founded the union, and spearheaded the process of obtaining official group recognition by the university, and managing bank accounts, general administration, and writing the group’s constitution.


Jun 2017 — Jun 2019


Event chair and host: program information session, Bioinformatics and Computational Biology Student Union, University of TorontoOrganized and hosted an annual information sessions for prospective and current students in the BCB program. I presented on program requirements, and moderated a student panel to share experiences in the program.


Mar 2018


Event chair: BioHacks, Bioinformatics and Computational Biology HackathonChaired and organized hackathon. Oversaw budget, and obtained funding from external sponsors: McLaughlin Centre, The Centre for the Analysis of Genome Evolution and Function, Department of Computer Science. I was awarded the UofT Student Initiative Fund, and the New College Student Council Winter Grant for this event.


Sep 2016 — May 2017


Communications and Marketing Executive, UofT Women in Computer Science (WiCS), University of TorontoPromoted events, managed event logistics: roombookings and refreshments for participants.


Sep 2016 — May 2017


Middle Year Representative, New College Student Council, University of TorontoChaired the commuter student outreach committee. Purchased apparel for the council store. Budgeted, promoted, and oversaw several community building events throughout the year. Participated in council steering meetings as a representative of the student body.
